Keywords: caps, emphasis, important, critical, priority, MUST
Description: Use ALL CAPS for critical requirements that must not be ignored
Syntax Example: MUST include blue sky. NEVER add watermarks. DO NOT modify face.
Tips: Use sparingly - 2-3 emphasis points max; overuse dilutes impact

Keywords: weight, emphasis, priority, stronger, weaker, balance
Description: Assign numerical weights to prompt terms for relative importance
When to Use: When balancing multiple elements or emphasizing specific aspects
Tips: 1.0 is default; 1.2-1.5 for emphasis; 0.5-0.8 to reduce; Midjourney uses :: syntax

Keywords: negative, avoid, exclude, remove, no, without, ban
Description: Specify what to exclude from the generated image
When to Use: To prevent common artifacts or unwanted elements
Syntax Example: Negative: ugly, blurry, deformed, watermark, extra limbs
Tips: Essential for SD/Flux; organize by category (anatomy, quality, style); keep concise

Keywords: reference, identity lock, face match, style transfer, consistency
Description: Use multiple images to maintain subject identity or style
When to Use: For consistent character generation or style matching
Syntax Example: Upload 6 object + 5 human refs (Nano Banana up to 14 images)
Tips: Collage multiple refs into single image for efficiency; specify which image for what purpose

Keywords: JSON, structured, organized, layered, metadata, schema
Description: Use JSON format for complex, multi-layer prompt organization
When to Use: For detailed scene descriptions with many parameters
Tips: Helps organize complex prompts; include meta_data, subject_layer, environment_layer, composition_and_tech

Keywords: narrative, paragraph, story, descriptive, natural language
Description: Write prompts as flowing paragraphs like briefing a photographer
When to Use: For models that understand natural language well (32K+ context)
Syntax Example: A professional portrait of a woman in her 30s, standing in an urban setting at golden hour...
Tips: More effective than keyword lists for Gemini; include context, mood, and intention

Keywords: photography, camera, lens, DSLR, professional, shot
Description: Use photography terms to anchor quality and realism
When to Use: For photorealistic results and specific camera aesthetics
Syntax Example: Captured with Canon EOS 90D, 85mm lens, f/1.8, shallow DOF, natural lighting
Tips: Include camera model, lens, aperture, lighting setup; triggers photorealistic training data

Keywords: hex, color code, precise color, #, RGB, specific color
Description: Use hex color codes instead of vague color names
Tips: Hex codes are unambiguous; include color name for context; use for brand colors

Keywords: aspect ratio, ar, dimensions, ratio, format, orientation
Description: Specify exact aspect ratio for output dimensions
Tips: Match platform requirements; 1:1 social, 9:16 stories, 16:9 widescreen, 21:9 cinematic

Keywords: iteration, refine, version, variation, A/B test, improve
Description: Generate variations and refine based on results
When to Use: For achieving optimal results through multiple generations
Syntax Example: Generate 4 variations → Select best → Refine weights → Upscale
Tips: Start broad, narrow down; save seeds for reproducibility; document successful prompts

Keywords: foreground, midground, background, layers, depth, z-index
Description: Describe scene in distinct depth layers
Syntax Example: Foreground: cherry blossoms. Midground: person walking. Background: Mount Fuji at sunset.
Tips: Creates visual depth; helps AI understand spatial relationships

Keywords: blend, mix, fusion, combine, hybrid, mashup
Syntax Example: Art nouveau meets cyberpunk, or '80s synthwave crossed with ukiyo-e woodblock print
Tips: Use 'meets', 'crossed with', 'fusion of'; weight styles if needed

Keywords: NEVER, avoid, exclude, prohibit, ban, NO
Description: Explicit statements of what must not appear
When to Use: To prevent unwanted content or artifacts
Syntax Example: NEVER include text or watermarks. DO NOT add any UI elements. Avoid red tones.
Tips: More effective than negative prompts for some models; be specific and explicit

Keywords: pan, tilt, dolly, tracking, crane, zoom, motion
Description: Specify camera movements for video generation
Syntax Example: Slow dolly forward, then gentle pan right revealing the landscape. Fade to next scene.
Tips: Use cinematography terms; specify speed and direction; include transitions

Keywords: identity, face lock, same person, consistent, preserve
Description: Techniques to maintain subject identity across generations
Syntax Example: Use reference as EXACT facial reference. STRICT identity lock. NO face modification.
Tips: Upload clear reference; explicitly state preservation requirements; use JSON locks

Keywords: panel, grid, collage, multi-image, split, diptych
Description: Request images with multiple panels or sections
Tips: Describe each panel clearly; maintain consistency across panels; specify layout (2x2, 1x3, etc.)

Keywords: search, real-time, current, live data, grounding, factual
Description: Enable real-time data for accurate current information
When to Use: For current events, accurate data visualization
Syntax Example: tools=[{'google_search': {}}] - enables real-time weather, charts, events
Tips: Use for infographics with current data; weather-accurate scenes; current event imagery

Description: Enable AI reasoning for complex compositions
Syntax Example: Enable thinking mode for complex multi-character scenes with specific interactions
Tips: Response includes part.thought; use for complex logic like 'kittens MUST have eyes matching fur'
